hook.title: The Dread Engine
hook.subtitle: Why Shakespeare Spoils the Ending
hook.tagline: The Prologue is a spoiler. Shakespeare kills suspense in the first 30 seconds to build something more devastating: Dread.
hook.insight:
Most stories ask: "What will happen?"
Romeo & Juliet asks: "How will I watch it happen?"

pattern.name: Prophetic Witnessing
pattern.core_dynamic: Shakespeare invented a pattern that makes tragedy feel inevitable. Once you see it, you can't unsee it.
pattern.reader_effect: As the play progresses, characters move closer to doom while believing in escape. The gap between hope and reality is where dread lives.

three_points.title: The Gap
three_points.text: Characters have hope. We have knowledge.

three_points.title: The Dread
three_points.text: We watch them pursue hope toward doom we already know.

anchor_quote.text: My grave is like to be my wedding bed.
anchor_quote.speaker: Juliet
anchor_quote.surface_meaning: If he's already married, I'll die unmarried.
anchor_quote.ironic_meaning: She's right‚Äîher wedding will lead to her grave.
anchor_quote.pattern_connection: Characters speak more truly than they know.

tension.title: Fate vs. Free Will
tension.intro: Every scene pulls in two directions.
tension.insight: Show how Shakespeare keeps the tension unresolved.

devices.name: Chorus Speech
devices.quote: A pair of star-crossed lovers take their life
devices.impact: Creates structural dramatic irony from line one.

devices.name: Dramatic Irony
devices.impact: Juliet discovers Romeo still warm‚Äîseconds too late.

devices.name: Foreshadowing
devices.quote: Methinks I see thee now, thou art so low
devices.impact: Juliet sees exactly what will happen.

devices.name: Oxymoron
devices.impact: Love can only be fulfilled in death.

devices.name: Aubade
devices.quote: It was the nightingale, and not the lark
devices.impact: Dawn = danger. We know this is their last meeting.

acts.title: The Prophecy
acts.event: Prologue announces death. Romeo and Juliet meet.
acts.quote: My only love sprung from my only hate!

acts.title: The Secret
acts.quote: It is the east, and Juliet is the sun.

acts.title: The Pivot
acts.event: Mercutio dies. Romeo kills Tybalt. Banishment.
acts.quote: A plague o' both your houses!

acts.title: The Plan
acts.quote: My grave is like to be my wedding bed ‚Äî fulfilled

acts.title: The Prophecy Fulfilled
acts.event: Romeo takes poison. Juliet wakes too late.
acts.quote: For never was a story of more woe

toolkit.title: The Killer Thesis
toolkit.text: Don't write: Shakespeare uses dramatic irony. Write: Shakespeare creates dread by announcing the ending.

toolkit.title: Connect Devices
toolkit.text: Show how devices serve the same pattern.

toolkit.title: Hold the Tension
toolkit.text: Don't pick a winner between fate and free will.

toolkit.title: Quote with Layers
toolkit.text: Show surface meaning vs. what we hear.

toolkit.title: Name the Pattern
toolkit.text: Using pattern name signals structural understanding.
